page.title: 15CLUTTON SCHOOL
page.content: Clutton School was built in 1902. The foundation stone was laid by the Countess of Warwick. The first headmaster was Mr. Pullen. His daughter, Mrs. Pritchard, still lives in Clutton. It was a school for all ages until Timsbury Secondary Modern was built in the 1930's. There have only been 4 headmasters since the school was built. They were Mr. Pullen,Mr. Hoyal, Mr.Bick and Mr. Small. We interviewed Mr. Small, the present Headmaster. He told us that he likes working with children. He likes teaching the children and running the school.He likes getting the best equipment for us to use, including the computer.Mr. Small thinks that the children are well behaved, kind, thoughtful and helpful.He is pleased about the wide range of sport we do.
